title: Fix /products page: filters, search, and results display
description:
Complete overhaul of /products page to make filters functional and results display correctly.

CURRENT STATE:
- ProductsFilters.tsx: UI renders but most filters DON'T actually filter results
- useFilters hook: Only applies q, tags, location (via workaround), conformsTo, primaryAccountable
- Backend EconomicResourceFilterParams: Limited filter support (no metadata filtering)
- Results: Shows projects but doesn't reflect filter state

COMPONENTS:
- pages/products.tsx - Main page, uses useFilters().proposalFilter
- components/ProductsFilters.tsx - Sidebar with filter UI (448 lines)
- components/ProductsSearchBar.tsx - Search input
- components/ProductsHeader.tsx - Stats header
- hooks/useFilters.ts - Transforms URL params to GraphQL filter
- components/ProjectsCards.tsx - Renders filtered results

FILTERS IN UI (ProductsFilters.tsx):
1. Manufacturability - radio buttons (all/can-manufacture/in-progress)
2. Machines Needed - checkboxes (3D Printer, CNC Mill, etc.)
3. Materials Needed - checkboxes (PLA, ABS, etc.)
4. Location - SearchLocation component
5. Categories & Tags - SelectTags component  
6. Power Compatibility - checkboxes (AC, DC, Battery, etc.)
7. Replicability - checkboxes (High, Medium, Low)

FILTERS ACTUALLY APPLIED TO QUERY:
- conformsTo (show filter: designs/products/services)
- classifiedAs (tags)
- orName (search query)
- orNote (location workaround)
- primaryAccountable

NOT APPLIED (backend doesn't support):
- manufacturability
- machinesNeeded  
- materialsNeeded
- powerCompatibility
- powerRequirement
- replicability

title: Fix ProductsHeader stats (total projects, available, manufacturers)
description:
ProductsHeader shows 3 stat cards with hardcoded/fake values.

CURRENT CODE (pages/products.tsx lines ~55-60):
const totalProjects = data?.economicResources?.pageInfo?.totalCount || 18429;
const projectsAvailable = Math.floor(totalProjects * 0.15) || 2847; // Approximate calculation
const manufacturers = 512; // This would need a separate query

PROBLEMS:
1. totalProjects: Falls back to hardcoded 18429
2. projectsAvailable: Arbitrary 15% calculation, meaningless
3. manufacturers: Completely hardcoded 512

WHAT STATS SHOULD MEAN:
1. Total Projects - All projects in system (current query is correct)
2. Projects Available - What does 'available' mean? Clarify with design:
   - Projects with files?
   - Projects that can be manufactured?
   - Projects with complete documentation?
3. Manufacturers - Count of unique primaryAccountable users
   - Requires separate query: count distinct primaryAccountable.id

SOLUTIONS:
1. totalProjects: Already works via GET_PRODUCTS_STATS query
2. projectsAvailable: Either remove or define clear meaning
3. manufacturers: Add GraphQL query for unique users count

NEW QUERY NEEDED:
query GetManufacturersCount {
  # Need backend support for distinct count
  # Or fetch all and count client-side (not ideal for large datasets)
}

ALTERNATIVE: Remove stats that can't be accurately calculated
